p: The continued observation of C. micronesica throughout Guam’s habitats led to the identification of two termites that feed on the stem or megasporophyll tissues ( Table 1) [ 32]. Finally, after 13 years of damage to Guam’s Cocos nucifera L. population, the invasive Oryctes rhinoceros L. population exhibited a host shift to begin feeding on C. micronesica stem tissue [ 34].
